content:
"Take On Me" is a classic! A-ha is an iconic 80s band, and that song is one of their most beloved hits. It's great that you've rediscovered your love for 80s synth-pop, and it's even more awesome that the "Retro Electro" playlist has been a great source of new music for you.

Saving 20 songs to your Favorites playlist in just 5 days is impressive! It's clear that the playlist has resonated with you, and you're excited to explore more music from that era. The 80s were a remarkable time for music, with the rise of synth-pop, new wave, and other genres that have had a lasting impact on the music industry.

If you're looking to dive deeper into 80s synth-pop, I'd recommend exploring artists like Depeche Mode, The Human League, Eurythmics, and Tears for Fears. These bands were pioneers of the genre and have a vast discography worth exploring. You might also want to check out some of the lesser-known bands from the era, like Alphaville, Heaven 17, or Thompson Twins.

What is it about 80s synth-pop that resonates with you? Is it the nostalgic value, the catchy melodies, or something else entirely?
